item.value: Note, when ``blocking == False``, it always succeeds, overwriting oldest data if there is no free slot.
blocking modes to ``enqueue`` and ``dequeue``, a stop event to terminate blocked processes, and putting buffer into shared memory.
Once stop event is set, all blocking ``enqueue`` and ``dequeue`` calls that happen afterwards will be skipped, unless the operation already started.
A batch of `sample_batch_size` items is returned, where each tensor in items will have its first dimension equal to sample_batch_size and the rest of the dimensions match the corresponding data_spec.
The environments where the sampels are from ordered in the returned batch.
Randomly get `batch_size` trajectories from the buffer.
Can only be applied on class methods, whose containing class must have ``_lock`` set to ``None`` or a ``multiprocessing.Lock`` object.
Cannot find a native torch function for setting default device. We have to hack our own.
A context manager for prefixing summary names.
Convert distributions to its parameters, and keep tensors unchanged. Only returns parameters that have ``Tensor`` values.
state used for calling ``rollout()`` to get the ``policy_step``.
this steps will be inaccurate if FINAL step comes before num_steps_per_skill
generate intrinsic rewards using the discriminator (fixed), for training the skill-conditioned policy.
take the skill generated during ``rollout_step`` and output it as the skill for the current time step.

This inspection detects type errors in function call expressions. Due to dynamic dispatch and duck typing, this is possible in a limited but useful number of cases. Types of function parameters can be specified in docstrings or in Python 3

This inspection detects type errors in function call expressions. Due to dynamic dispatch and duck typing, this is possible in a limited but useful number of cases. Types of function parameters can be specified in doc strings or in Python 3
tag (str): the summary tag for the the time.
Create a context object for recording time.
Both observation and action are a stacking of recent states, with the most recent one appearing at index=0.
this function makes the skill-conditioned observation for the lower-level policy.
Scores the sample by inverting the transform(s)
Scores the sample by inverting the transform(s) and computing the score using the score of the base distribution and the log abs det jacobian.
_collect train info parallelly
This function additionally transforms rewards on top of the ``transform_timestep()`` of the base class ``Algorithm``.
Run ``func`` under summary record context.
observe for replay
Record an experience in a replay buffer.
path is useful when an algorithm needs to directly access the data about itself in replay buffer
it will be stored into retrieved from replay buffer and and retrieved for ``train_step()`` as ``rollout_info``.
Transform the node of a nested structure indicated by ``field`` using ``func``.

If you simply want to do some conditional computation without actually returning any results. You can use conditional_update in the following way:

temporally batched inputs for the ``rollout_step()`` of the root algorithm collected during ``unroll()``.

temporally bached inputs for the ``rollout_step()`` of the root algorithm collected during ``unroll()``.
This function will serve the same purpose with ``after_update`` if there is always only one gradient update in each training iteration. Otherwise it's less frequently called than ``after_update``.
This is in contrast to Sutskever et. al. and other frameworks which employ an update of the form
The implementation of SGD with MomentumNesterov subtly differs from Sutskever et. al.
dampening for momentum
enables Nesterov momentum
coefficients used for computing running averages of gradient and its square (default: (0.9, 0.999)).
